meanings.definition: Assistants who serve under a minister or other official.
meanings.sent1: The subministers helped the minister with paperwork and scheduling.
meanings.sent2: The team of subministers worked diligently to support the official in their duties.
meanings.sent3: The subministers organized a surprise party for the minister to show their appreciation.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of the office, the subministers were the backbone of the team.
meanings.sent5: The subministers' loyalty and dedication were unmatched.

meanings.definition: To provide assistance or support to someone in a subordinate role.
meanings.sent1: She subministers guidance to new employees to help them settle into their roles.
meanings.sent2: The team subministers aid to those in need during times of crisis.
meanings.sent3: He subministers encouragement to his friends when they feel down.
meanings.sent4: The community subministers care and compassion to all its members.
meanings.sent5: The teacher subministers knowledge to her students with patience and kindness.
